name: Stack and Queue Operations
latex: \text{Stack: LIFO (Last In First Out)}, \quad \text{Queue: FIFO (First In First Out)}
explanation: Stacks and queues are fundamental linear data structures. Stack: push (add top), pop (remove top) - LIFO order. Queue: enqueue (add rear), dequeue (remove front) - FIFO order. Both have O(1) operations. Stacks used for function calls, expression evaluation, undo operations. Queues used for task scheduling, BFS, and buffering. Essential for many algorithms and system design.

examples.problem: Push 1, 2, 3 onto stack, then pop twice. What remains?
Enqueue 1, 2, 3 into queue, then dequeue twice. What remains?
